name: Adina Apartment Hotel Canberra, James Court

reviews.text: I feel very strongly about the safety of the balcony attached to the living area of our apartment at the Adina Apartment Hotel. We were on the second floor overlooking the swimming pool. The heat exchange units for the airconditioning were secured flush to the balcony wall and therefore gave any young child a perfect climbing aid to be on a level with the railing and therefore a potentially lethal drop to the pool two stories below. Even adults sitting on the higher of the two units would have cause to be very careful. We have had too many balcony falls in Australia in the last few weeks.
reviews.title: Unsafe balcony.

reviews.text: I accept that parents and grandparents have a responsibility to supervise children but this was an area waiting for an accident to happen.
reviews.title: Noisy!

reviews.text: Moreover there was no proper keyed lock on the balcony door, just a catch to prevent outsiders from entering. This meant that you could not lock the door to the balcony from the inside to provide a safe environment indoors. The safety standards required of domestic pools would seem to be more arduous than those needed for a balcony in a commercial enterprise. I believe that this balcony is unsafe.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel Stay EVER!!!

reviews.text: Other aspects of the stay.
reviews.title: Value for money, spacious & family friendly!

reviews.text: Check-in;
reviews.title: Fantastic apartment - bit far from attractions

reviews.text: This place was quite good - spacious 2 bed apartment although the bedrooms were smallish. Furniture a bit tired and some street noise even though the windows were all closed. Extra $15 per night for car parking. Checkout was slow. We got a really good price on the adina website so that was a big plus!
reviews.title: Good location, nice big apartment

reviews.text: Having read the trip advisor reviews after we had been booked into this hotel by a travel agent, I was really worried. However although it was by no means the best hotel we have stayed in , it was also not the worst. I think we may have had a refurbished room (806) on the top floor, as the couch had only a couple of stains. The rest of the apartment was mostly clean. Wifi is available, but the cost is exorbitant. We really only slept in the apartment, eating out for all meals. The location was nice and central, but the 24hour Maccas was noisy. I don't think we would stay here again.
reviews.title: Not as bad as I expected

reviews.text: I stayed in the two bedroom apartment for four nights and honestly couldn't wait to get back home. The first room I was assigned had curtains hanging off the rails and smelt like someone had been smoking in it. Without even laying on the bed I could see it had sunk in at the middle. I called reception to ask to be moved which resulted in me waiting 20 minutes for a call back which never came. I called again and was asked to come downstairs to pick up the new room key as they were really busy at the moment. The 2nd room wasn't much better - the same smell as the previous apartment.
reviews.title: Overpriced and filthy

reviews.text: The kitchen was dirty and the bathrooms hadn't been cleaned properly - during my stay rubbish was left behind by housekeeping and the bed was half made. For the price of these rooms you would expect higher. I stayed here through my company and will be making a special request to have this location removed from our preferred suppliers as I wouldn't want another colleague to stay here. Unfortunately Parliament was sitting and there were no rooms available at any other hotels - I asked / begged numerous times.
reviews.title: A horrible place to stay

reviews.text: This apartment does not live up to other Adina / Medina experiences I have had - it is well below the expected standard and more closely aligned to a Motel style room / service.
reviews.title: Nice, big apartment, great location. Stains on furniture.

reviews.text: We always stay at the James Court Medina and always find it fantastic! The rooms are large with a large lounge and fully equipped kitchen - better than my one at home! The spa bath is always used when we visit and the pool is always sparkling clean.
reviews.title: Love this place!

reviews.text: I booked a 2 bedroom apartment here. One bedroom was ok, the other one was a dark cell with a tiny window, no air condition or ventilation and just enough room for 2 single beds. Everything in the apartment was old and tired, the carpet filthy and all the mosquito nets in the windows either loose, broken or both. When I used the laundry dryer, the fuse went off several times. In the morning when I went down to the pool for a swim there were cigarette butts and other garbage floating in the pool, pretty disgusting. Parking is the basement is anoying as guest parking is on the same level as resident parking and it takes you ages to find a free spot that you can use. Wouldn't stay here again, it's definitely not worth the money.
reviews.title: Stay away from this place.

reviews.text: I had been looking forward to staying at the Medina, deciding to give it a go even after reading previous reviews - who knows, I thought I would have a different experience. However, after spending a few nights in the Medina, I have the opinion of finding some place else.
reviews.title: Not worth the price tag.

reviews.text: The positive is the hotel is conveniently located and close to restaurant and shops. The one-bedroom quite large and spacious.
reviews.title: Disappointing visits
Very very Ordinary at an extraordinary price
reviews.text: The not so positive was opening the ancient microwave to find stains and splotches of sauce left by previous guests. I wasn't game to using the rest of the kitchen after seeing the microwave although on the surface everything appeared clean. And while the room is spacious, it is indeed dated - as are the appliances. There are a lot of little notes everywhere to remind you of things, such as how laundry powder is $3.50 and that if you choose to fill the spa you won't have hot water for roughly 1-2 hours. My balcony was also a pigeon roost and there were droppings everywhere and all over the air conditioner.

We have just returned from staying at this property and I had booked and paid before reading the reviews (a late night decision) and I was really concerned about staying after I had visited this site. Although a late request for a high floor away from Northbourne was unable to be accommodated, the thing that was most important to me, a clean room, was what I got. We were given room 219, second floor on Northbourne and although a little noisy, I didn't find it too bad, I have young children and am used to being woken up prior to 7am. The pool was clean and my daughter and I enjoyed an afternoon swim each day. Although the parking was a bit tricky later at night it was nothing different to what I have experienced at apartments on the Gold Coast, although I think the parking should not be an added extra considering the location and inability to park anywhere else, such as when you stay at apartments at other locations around the country.
reviews.title: 3.5 stars, Good Location, slightly older apartments, apprehension put at ease

reviews.text: Everything in the room was clean, as said, but the bathrooms and the bed are getting a little tired, I believe the apartment I stayed in had been recently (last 12-24 months) repainted, recarpeted, new air conditioners and living room furniture updated. All in all I was happy with my stay and would stay again, but would most likely request the same room number, considering the other reviews that have been negative.
reviews.title: Old style apartments but great location
Very poor
reviews.text: The only appliances I used were the TV, Fridge and Hairdryer so can't comment on any others, I did check the microwave though and it was clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service at the Reception Desk on the way in was good and the staff member was friendly, service on the way out could have been improved slightly, with a staff member commencing to serve me, then answering the phone, where someone else should have picked this up.
reviews.title: Good Location Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally, great location, easy to get in and out of and easy to get to anywhere in 10 minutes.
reviews.title: Pictures aren't always what they seem

aka: Medina Executive James Court Hotel Canberra
